de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.itemstate

Interface ItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>

  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, NoChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter, ExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation

    public interface ItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary group and child items, which may have different states, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfGroupStates

        int getNumberOfGroupStates()
        Returns the number of states, the adapter's group items may have.
        Returns:
        The number of states, the adapter's group items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1

      • setNumberOfGroupStates

        void setNumberOfGroupStates(int numberOfGroupStates)
        Sets the number of states, the adapter's group items may have. If the number of states is set to a value, less than the previous value, the states of the group items, which became obsolete, will be set to the maximum state.
        Parameters:
        numberOfGroupStates - The number of states, which should be set, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown

      • minGroupState

        int minGroupState()
        Returns the minimum state, the adapter's group items may have.
        Returns:
        The minimum state, the adapter's group items may have, as an Integer value

      • maxGroupState

        int maxGroupState()
        Returns the maximum state, the adapter's group items may have.
        Returns:
        The maximum state, the adapter's group items may have, as an Integer value

      • getGroupState

        int getGroupState(int groupIndex)
        Returns the current state of the group item, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose state should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The state of the group item, which belongs to the given index, as a Integer value

      • getGroupState

        int getGroupState(@NonNull
                  GroupType group)
        Returns the current state of a specific group item.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, whose state should be returned, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null. If the group item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The state of the given group item as an Integer value

      • setGroupState

        int setGroupState(int groupIndex,
                  int state)
        Sets the state of the group item, which belongs to a specific index, to a specific state, if it is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose state should be set, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfGroupStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the group item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • setGroupState

        int setGroupState(@NonNull
                  GroupType group,
                  int state)
        Sets the state of a specific group item to a specific state, if it is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, whose state should be set, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null. If the group item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfGroupStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the given group item as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • setAllGroupStates

        boolean setAllGroupStates(int state)
        Sets the states of all group items to a specific state, if they are currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfGroupStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the states of all group items have been changed, false otherwise

      • triggerGroupState

        int triggerGroupState(int groupIndex)
        Triggers the state of the group item, which belongs to a specific index, if it is currently enabled. This causes the state to be increased by one. If the state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the group item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • triggerGroupState

        int triggerGroupState(boolean triggerChildStates,
                      int groupIndex)
        Triggers the state of the group item, which belongs to a specific index, if it is currently enabled. This causes the state to be increased by one. If the state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Parameters:
        triggerChildStates - True, if the states of the group's children should also be triggered, false otherwise
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the group item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • triggerGroupState

        int triggerGroupState(@NonNull
                      GroupType group)
        Triggers the state of a specific group item, if it is currently enabled. This causes the state to be increased by one. If the state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, whose state should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null. If the group item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the given group item, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • triggerGroupState

        int triggerGroupState(boolean triggerChildStates,
                      @NonNull
                      GroupType group)
        Triggers the state of a specific group item, if it is currently enabled. This causes the state to be increased by one. If the state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Parameters:
        triggerChildStates - True, if the states of the group's children should also be triggered, false otherwise
        group - The group item, whose state should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null. If the group item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the given group item, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • triggerAllGroupStates

        boolean triggerAllGroupStates()
        Triggers the states of all group items, regardless of the group they belong to, if they are currently enabled. This causes the states to be increased by one. If a state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Returns:
        True, if the states of all group items have been changed, false otherwise

      • triggerAllGroupStates

        boolean triggerAllGroupStates(boolean triggerChildStates)
        Triggers the states of all group items, regardless of the group they belong to, if they are currently enabled. This causes the states to be increased by one. If a state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Parameters:
        triggerChildStates - True, if the states of the groups' children should also be triggered, false otherwise
        Returns:
        True, if the states of all group items have been changed, false otherwise

      • getFirstGroupIndexWithSpecificState

        int getFirstGroupIndexWithSpecificState(int state)
        Returns the index of the first group item, which currently has a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the group item, whose index should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The index of the first group item, which currently has the given state, as an Integer value or -1, if the adapter does not contain a group item with the given state

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getGroupIndicesWithSpecificState(int state)
        Returns a list, which contains the indices of all group items, which currently have a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the group items, whose indices should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the indices of all group items, which currently have a specific state, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if the adapter does not contain any group items with the given state

      • getGroupsWithSpecificState

        java.util.List<GroupType> getGroupsWithSpecificState(int state)
        Returns a list, which contains all group items, which currently have a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the group items, which should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the group items, which currently have the given state, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if the adapter contains no group items with the given state

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getChildState

        int getChildState(@NonNull
                  GroupType group,
                  int childIndex)
        Returns the current state of the child item, which belongs to a specific index of a specific group.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose state should be returned, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose state should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(group):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The state of the child item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value

      • getChildState

        int getChildState(@NonNull
                  GroupType group,
                  @NonNull
                  ChildType child)
        Returns the current state of a specific child item, which belongs to a specific group.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose state should be returned, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        child - The child item, whose state should be returned, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The child may not be null. If the child does not belong to the given group, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The state of the given child item, as an Integer value

        int getChildState(int groupIndex,
                  int childIndex)

        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose state should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(groupIndex):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The state of the child item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value

      • setChildState

        int setChildState(@NonNull
                  GroupType group,
                  int childIndex,
                  int state)
        Sets the state of the child item, which belongs to a specific index of a specific group, to a specific state, if it is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose state should be set, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose state should be set, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(group):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfChildStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the child item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • setChildState

        int setChildState(@NonNull
                  GroupType group,
                  @NonNull
                  ChildType child,
                  int state)
        Sets the state of a specific child item, which belongs to a specific group, to a specific state, if it is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose state should be set, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        child - The child item, whose state should be set, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The child may not be null. If the child does not belong to the given group, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfChildStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the given child item, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • setChildState

        int setChildState(int groupIndex,
                  int childIndex,
                  int state)
        Sets the state of the child item, which belongs to a specific index of the group, which belongs to a specific index, to a specific state, if it is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item, whose state should be set, belongs to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose state should be set, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(group):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfChildStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the child item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • triggerChildState

        int triggerChildState(@NonNull
                      GroupType group,
                      int childIndex)
        Triggers the state of the child item, which belongs to a specific index of a specific group, if it is currently enabled. This causes the state to be increased by one. If the state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose state should be triggered, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(group):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the child item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed
